meanings.sent1: The test paper had a blank space for my name.
meanings.sent2: She stared at the blank canvas, unsure of what to paint.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a blank card out of his hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt as blank as a white sheet of paper, unable to come up with any ideas.
meanings.sent5: The room was so quiet, it felt like a blank page waiting to be filled with sound.

meanings.definition: (n.) A space left empty for writing or drawing
meanings.sent1: Please fill in the blank with your answer.
meanings.sent2: She doodled in the blank margins of her notebook during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The artist left a blank in the painting, creating a sense of mystery.
meanings.sent4: The blank on the form seemed to stare back at him, demanding to be completed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to complete the blanks in the story with their own words.

meanings.definition: (v.) To cover or obscure something with a blank surface
meanings.sent1: He tried to blank out the graffiti on the wall with white paint.
meanings.sent2: The snowfall blanketed the city in a layer of white.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally blanked the important message with a swipe of her hand.
meanings.sent4: The fog blanketed the valley, hiding everything from view.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night blanketed the landscape, making it hard to see.
